document_title: Foreskin inflammation: Causes, signs and prevention
subsection_content:
Most cases of foreskin inflammation do not go away on their own without an appropriate treatment regimen. When severe, the disease can cause the penis to change shape, leading to many dangerous complications, seriously affecting men's daily lives.
Therefore, when there are symptoms of foreskin inflammation, patients should quickly go to reputable medical facilities for timely examination, diagnosis and treatment, to prevent serious complications.
If treatment is delayed, men may face complications such as:
Onset of other inflammatory diseases: After entering, bacteria can cause ulcers in the foreskin and can develop and penetrate deeper into other organs. They cause many inflammatory diseases such as vasculitis, orchitis, epididymitis...; Reduced sexual desire: Foreskin inflammation causes men to always have pain. Therefore, patients often lose interest in sex. Over time, the disease can cause physiological dysfunction, erectile dysfunction, impotence, premature ejaculation...; Infertility and subfertility: Chronic balanitis can reduce the quantity and quality of sperm, thereby increasing the risk of infertility and subfertility.; Penile cancer: Foreskin inflammation accompanied by ulcers and pus discharge can increase the risk of penile cancer.
Foreskin inflammation reduces sexual desire
In addition, balanitis can cause urethritis and cystitis. In some cases, kidney function may be affected, increasing the risk of kidney failure.
